Name: Issue 347
Summary: Even more news around the MAUI RC
Introduction: G'day everyone, welcome to issue #347 of Weekly Xamarin - a wrap-up of the community articles around Xamarin and MAUI communities this week. Lots of articles about the MAUI Release Candidate this week and some good information if you are looking migrate your libraries across. Interestingly, Jon Skeet has been having a bit of a dig into the framework too. Until next week, take care. Kym

Articles.Title: Figma Config 2022
Articles.Description: Config is Figma’s annual conference where users come together to learn from each other. This year, it’ll take place virtually over a 24 hour period. It's totally free to tune in, so if you enjoy good design you should check it out.
Articles.Author: Figma

Articles.Title: Background Work in Xamarin.Forms. Part #1 — Xamarin.Android
Articles.Description: What should we select if we need to run some work in the background? Should it be a Worker, Service or simple Task Run from .Net?
Articles.Author: Bohdan Benetskyi

Articles.Title: Replicating a Game Store UI in Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: This blog post discusses replicating a game store UI based on a Dribbble design.
Articles.Author: Leomaris Reyes

Articles.Title: Porting your Xamarin.Forms library to .NET MAUI
Articles.Description: If you need to port to a .NET MAUI library your Xamarin.Forms library, you are in the right place.
Articles.Author: Luis Matos

Articles.Title: Taking .NET MAUI for a spin
Articles.Description: Stack Overflow sensation takes .NET MAUI for a spin and gives his impressions.
Articles.Author: Jon Skeet

Articles.Title: Handling Overlay Elements in .NET MAUI with ZIndex | Syncfusion Blogs
Articles.Description: If you’re working in .NET MAUI, and you have two or more controls on top of each other that need to be revealed based on certain conditions, this article will undoubtedly assist you in handling that problem. The order in which an element appears on the z-axis is represented by ZIndex.
Articles.Author: Jayaleshwari N

Articles.Title: .NET MAUI RC1 is available with VS for Mac support
Articles.Description: If you have issues with VS for Mac 2022 and the new MAUI RC this might help you out.

Articles.Title: Xamarin.Forms, .NET Maui and the Uno Platform
Articles.Description: Nick Randolph takes a quick look at MAUI and how it compares to both it’s predecessor, Xamarin.Forms, and the Uno Platform.
Articles.Author: Nick Randolph

Articles.Title: Replicating Foodora UI in .NET MAUI - Part 3
Articles.Description: Continuing the UI design for the Foodora app, Andreas replicates the third page, where they list all the dishes for a specific restaurant.
Articles.Author: Andreas Nesheim

Articles.Title: All-in-One .NET MAUI App Project Template
Articles.Description: An update to the All-in-One .NET MAUI App Project Templates. Celebrate .NET MAUI RC1 release in style with more features.
Articles.Author: Vijay Anand EG

Articles.Title: The .NET MAUI Podcast Episode 110: RELEASE CANDIDATE!
Articles.Description: Join James, Matt and David discussing the .NET MAUI RC.
Articles.Author: .NET MAUI Podcast

Articles.Title: Merge Conflict: 302: .NET MAUI Release Candidate Is Here!
Articles.Description: It is go time with the .NET MAUI RC!!
Articles.Author: Merge Conflict

Articles.Title: DevTalk 80: Best practices for XAML. With Leomaris Reyes
Articles.Description: On this episode of DevTalk Kerry speaks to Leomaris Reyes about best practices for XAML for Xamarin.Forms and .NET MAUI.
Articles.Author: Kerry Lothrop

Articles.Title: .NET MAUI Release Candidates!
Articles.Description: .NET MAUI Release Candidate is here! With a "go live" license to boot! This means it is time to start building cross-platform native apps across iOS, Android, macOS, and Windows from a shared C# codebase! Today, I walkthrough everything you need to know to get started with the .NET MAUI Release Candidate on both Windows and on Mac with Visual Studio 2022.
Articles.Author: James Montemagno
